net.sf.jclal.util.sort

Class IndexValueContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.util.sort.IndexValueContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AcumulativeDistanceContainer, DistanceContainer

    public class IndexValueContainer
extends Object
    Class to store values in accordance with an index and a value, for the specific case of that the elements change their position and it is necessary to preserve their original position.
    Author:
    Oscar Gabriel Reyes Pupo, Eduardo Perez Perdomo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double[] acumulativeValue
      To store the accumulative value.
      protected int[] indexesChanges
      It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) of the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array.
      protected double maxAcumulativeValue
      The max accumulative value
      protected int size
      Keep the current valid number of elements.
      protected boolean updateMaxAcumulativeValue
      It takes whether is necessary to determine the maximum accumulative value

    • Field Detail

      • indexesChanges

        protected int[] indexesChanges
        It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) of the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array. It accelerates the process to obtain the similarity value between two instances.

      • size

        protected int size
        Keep the current valid number of elements.

      • acumulativeValue

        protected double[] acumulativeValue
        To store the accumulative value.

      • updateMaxAcumulativeValue

        protected boolean updateMaxAcumulativeValue
        It takes whether is necessary to determine the maximum accumulative value

      • maxAcumulativeValue

        protected double maxAcumulativeValue
        The max accumulative value

      • obtainOrdered

        protected ArrayList<Container> obtainOrdered(ArrayList<Integer> removedIndexes)
        The elements are located in descendant order.
        Parameters:
        removedIndexes - The indexes of the removed instances.
        Returns:
        An arraylist with the elements in order.

      • getIndexesChanges

        public int[] getIndexesChanges()
        It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) with the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array.
        Returns:
        the indexes changes.

      • setIndexesChanges

        public void setIndexesChanges(int[] indexesChanges)
        It stores a pair of values that represents the new index (key) with the current index of the array, and the old index (value) of an instance with the values stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        indexesChanges - The indexes that were changed.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the size.
        Returns:
        The current size. The size changes from calling to the method deleteIndex(int index).

      • isUpdateMaxAcumulativeValue
